description: SLOP (Semi-Leptonic Observable Predictions) is a python package for computation of semi-leptonic angular observables from varying Wilson coefficients and form factors. The implementation uses flavio and implements form factors from Hammer and EOS to generate predictions and errorbands for either built-in or user-defined form-factors at varying Wilson Coefficients.
references: D. Straub, "flavio: a Python package for flavour and precision phenomenology in the Standard Model and beyond" arXiv:1810.08132
The EOS Authors Collaboration, van Dyk, D., & and others. (2025). EOS: A Software for Flavor Physics Phenomenology (v1.0.19). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.17792609

Bernlochner, F. U., Duell, S., Ligeti, Z., Papucci, M., & Robinson, D. J. (2024). HAMMER - Helicity Amplitude Module for Matrix Element Reweighting (1.4.1). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11245573
title: SLOP: A package for Semi-Leptonic Observable Predictions
